context: Exhaled NO Exhaled NO was measured in EXP1. Orally and nasally exhaled NO levels before exposure did not differ between control and HBO2. HBO2 induced a 30% decrease in oral FENO while there was no change after the control experiment (Table 1 , Fig. 2A and B ). HBO2 also led to a decrease by 16% in nasal FENO while control treatment had no effect (Table 1, Fig. 2C and D). When subtracting oral FENO from nasal FENO in order to get values more representative of the nasal airway NO production similar findings were observed; a 14% decrease in nasal FENO was seen after HBO2 while control had no effect (Table 1, Fig. 2E and F).Salivary nitrate and nitrite Oral nitrate and nitrite reducing bacteria contribute to NO levels in exhaled air and therefore salivary nitrite and nitrate levels were measured in EXP1 and EXP2. In EXP1 salivary nitrite and nitrate levels showed a substantial variation between subjects but there was no significant difference in any parameter between the groups before interventions. There were no changes in salivary nitrite and nitrate after HBO2 or control treatment (Table 1). As an indication of bacterial conversion of salivary nitrate to nitrite, the salivary nitrite/nitrate ratio was calculated, where a higher ratio indicates a higher conversion.
